Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 01:37PM justdiagnosed wrote: Hi! Just saw my breast specialist and oncologist today and they suggested that chemo will be best for me before having an operation.my lump measures 20 mm or 2 cm and they want to shrink it first.they have reassured me that this is the best option as chemo will also kill cancer cells that are roaming around my body as well.the oncologist also mentioned about avastin the drug that is on trial for early stage breast cancer,im not sure if i will go with the trial as i dont know if it will be beneficial for me.im getting scared of the side effects of chemo. hopefully everything will be ok.i trust in the lord,he will take care of me.

Posts.Content: May 22, 2011 06:29AM justdiagnosed wrote: hi alliesmom15! sorry to hear about your dx.i know what you are feeling right now..been there..but i tell you it will get better as you get to see your doctors and tell you what will be your treatment plan.there will be lots of tests and scans to deal with.but we just have to take it  one day at a time,im sure you will get the best treatment available.just hang in there and don't forget a lot of us are experiencing this difficult times but as they say there is always a light at the end of the tunnel.cheer up and hope you are feeling well today.hugs!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: May 24, 2011 01:48AM justdiagnosed wrote: hi sandy! nice to hear from you.im meeting my surgeon on thursday to discuss my surgery.they mentioned lumpectomy but im not sure if that will be the case as i want a mastectomy.they did not tell me the grade as far as i know mine is invasive ductal carcinoma ,no lymph node invasion.they did an ultrasound 2 weeks ago and a core biopsy of my axillary tail lymph node and thanks god it came back negative so they decided to change my treatment from chemo to surgery.im just inpatiently waiting...im also due to have ct scan on the 31st for cancer staging hopefully no mets! hope everything goes well to all of us! lots of hugs!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2011 02:22AM justdiagnosed wrote: hi alliesmom 15 ! hope you are feeling good today.your treatment is really fast,i'm having my lumpectomy on monday june 6.it's been 4 weeks since i was diagnosed,my nurse said it will be 2-3 weeks after my op then i will start my chemo.i'm having slight discomfort in my right breast where my cancer is so i just can't wait until monday to get rid of the tumor.hoping that cancer has not spread to my lymph nodes.i had my ct scan on tuesday and thank God they have not found any nodes or lesions in my other organs.i too shouldn't complain about the wait..it takes time to organize scans and appointments to the specialists.we all be out of this shadow in no time..so just hang there and will be all smilling soon.hugs!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: May 10, 2011 03:21AM justdiagnosed wrote: thanks for taking time to reply on my post chrissy.i really appreciate your kindness.i will let you know what the surgeon says on thursday.hopefully treatment will follow soon.god bless and hope all is well with you. justdiagnosed
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: May 26, 2011 01:15AM - edited May 26, 2011 01:16AM by justdiagnosed hi ajtaylor! i was told that a few weeks of waiting would not do any harm as in cancer spreading.i have been waiting for almost 4 weeks since my initial diagnosis,i'm meeting my surgeon today and discuss surgery.'im due for chemo on june 3 but everything has changed as they decided to do the surgery first.i'm hoping that they will give me the date of my surgery and won't wait for another 2 weeks.i'm getting tired of waiting now.i do have some bouts of sadness like yesterday i just didn't realize that i'm crying myself out loud.i guess it's part of the breast cancer emotional roller coaster.whatever instore for me i pray and ask God to give me strength to carry on fighting this battle.i'm sure ajtaylor as soon you hear from your doctors and  you know your plan of treatment it will get better.its the first few days after knowing you have bc is the worst bit but after that you will get to terms with it and acceptance will follow.hugs and kiss to your baby girl!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 01:44PM justdiagnosed wrote: Thanks for all your support i find strength from reading all your posts.im glad i found this site because it somewhat takes out my worries.hugs and kisses to all!

Posts.Content: May 13, 2011 12:49PM justdiagnosed wrote: Hi mlabroll! I too find this site very helpful indeed.when i think of my bc and starts to cry i open the discussion board and somewhat find strength specially when reading some of the women stories who have survived bc.i know it will be tough and will have ups and downs along the road but i know we can fight this till the end.we just need to get strenght from the Lord and make our loveones our inspiration to carry on fighting this cancer.when i see my husband who is very supportive,my 2 children i tell myself "this is a piece of cake" and im going to enjoy eating it.well we just have to find some humor from all of this.take care mlabroll and all the best.
